com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app

Class SmartApplication

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.app.Application
          • com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app.SmartApplication
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks

    public abstract class SmartApplication
extends android.app.Application
    An abstract to be implemented when using the framework, because it initializes some of the components, and eases the development. If you use your own implementation, do not forget to declare it in the AndroidManifest.xml.
    Since:
    2009.08.21
    Author:
    Ã‰douard Mercier

      protected static class  SmartApplication.I18N
      Contains various attributes in order to have the default dialog boxes related to exceptions i18ned.

    • Method Detail

      • isOnCreatedDone

        public static boolean isOnCreatedDone()
        Enables to know whether the onCreateCustom() method has been invoked.
        Returns:
        true if and only if the onCreateCustom() method has been invoked and its executio is over

      • getLogReportRecipient

        protected abstract java.lang.String getLogReportRecipient()
        If the application uses an SmartApplication.DefaultExceptionHandler as an ActivityController.ExceptionHandler, when a managed exception is detected, and is not handled, a dialog box is submitted to the end-user, in order to propose to send the bug cause by inspecting the Android logcat. In that case, do not forget to declare the android.permission.READ_LOGS permission in the AndroidManifest.xml.
        Returns:
        the e-mail address that will be used when submitting an error log message ; if it returns null, the application will not propose to send the bug cause

      • getPreferences

        protected final android.content.SharedPreferences getPreferences()

        Caution: this method will return null as long as the parent Application.onCreate() has not been invoked.

        Returns:
        the shared preferences of the application

      • getFrameworkVersionString

        public static java.lang.String getFrameworkVersionString()
        Returns:
        the human-readable version of the framework the application is using

      • shouldBeSilent

        protected boolean shouldBeSilent()
        A callback method which enables to indicate whether the process newly created should use the default SmartApplication workflow.

        It is useful when having multiple processes for the same application, and that some of the processes should not use the framework.

        Returns:
        true if and only if you want the framework to be ignored for the process. Returns false by default
        See Also:
        onCreateCustomSilent()

      • getSystemServiceProvider

        protected ActivityController.SystemServiceProvider getSystemServiceProvider()
        This callback will be invoked by the application instance, in order to get a reference on the application ActivityController.SystemServiceProvider: this method is responsible for creating an implementation of this component interface. Override this method, in order to override the system services which are provided by default by an Activity.

        It is ensured that the framework will only call once this method (unless you explicitly invoke it, which you should not), during the Application.onCreate() method execution.

        Returns:
        an instance which enables to override or provide additional system services. If null, the Activity default system services will be returned
        See Also:
        ActivityController.registerSystemServiceProvider(ActivityController.SystemServiceProvider)

      • getActivityRedirector

        protected ActivityController.Redirector getActivityRedirector()
        This callback will be invoked by the application instance, in order to get a reference on the application ActivityController.Redirector: this method is responsible for creating an implementation of this component interface. Override this method, in order to control the redirection mechanism.

        It is ensured that the framework will only call once this method (unless you explicitly invoke it, which you should not), during the Application.onCreate() method execution.

        Returns:
        an instance which indicates how to redirect activities if necessary. If null, this means that no redirection is handled. Returns null by default
        See Also:
        ActivityController.registerRedirector(ActivityController.Redirector)

      • getInterceptor

        protected ActivityController.Interceptor getInterceptor()
        This callback will be invoked by the application instance, in order to get a reference on the application ActivityController.Interceptor: this method is responsible for creating an implementation of this component interface. Override this method, in order to control the interception mechanism.

        It is ensured that the framework will only call once this method (unless you explicitly invoke it, which you should not), during the Application.onCreate() method execution.

        Returns:
        an instance which will be invoked on every Activity life-cycle event. IF null, this means that no interception is handled. Returns null by default
        See Also:
        ActivityController.registerInterceptor(ActivityController.Interceptor)

      • getExceptionHandler

        protected ActivityController.ExceptionHandler getExceptionHandler()
        This callback will be invoked by the application instance, in order to get a reference on the application ActivityController.ExceptionHandler: this method is responsible for creating an implementation of this component interface. Override this method, in order to handle more specifically some application-specific exceptions.

        It is ensured that the framework will only call once this method (unless you explicitly invoke it, which should not be the case), during the Application.onCreate() method execution.

        Returns:
        an instance which will be invoked when an exception occurs during the application, provided the exception is handled by the framework ; may be null, if no ActivityController.ExceptionHandler should be used by the application. Returns a new instance of SmartApplication.ExceptionHandler by default
        See Also:
        ActivityController.registerExceptionHandler(ExceptionHandler)

      • getI18N

        protected abstract SmartApplication.I18N getI18N()
        This method will be invoked by the getExceptionHandler() method when building an ActivityController.AbstractExceptionHandler instance. This internationalization instance will be used to populate default dialog boxes texts popped-up by this default ActivityController.ExceptionHandler. Hence, the method will be invoked at the application start-up.
        Returns:
        an instance which contains the internationalized text strings for some built-in error dialog boxes. You need to define that method.

      • onCreate

        public final void onCreate()
        The method will invoke the onCreateCustom() method, provided the method returns false, and will perform the following things:
        1. set the log level,
        2. register the ActivityController.ExceptionHandler,
        3. register the ActivityController.Redirector,
        4. register the ActivityController.Interceptor,
        5. register an internal default Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler for the UI and for the background threads,
        6. logs how much time the onCreate() method execution took.

        Note: if the method has already been invoked once, the second time (because of a concurrent access), it will do nothing but output an error log. This is the reason why the method has been declared as synchronized.

        Overrides:
        onCreate in class android.app.Application
        See Also:
        getLogLevel(), getExceptionHandler(), getActivityRedirector(), getInterceptor()

      • onSetupExceptionHandlers

        protected void onSetupExceptionHandlers()
        This is the place where to register other default exception handlers like ACRA. The default implementation does nothing, and if overriden, this method should not invoke its super method.

        It is ensured that the framework default exception handlers will be set-up after this method, and they will fallback to the already registered default exception handlers.

      • onCreateCustomSilent

        protected void onCreateCustomSilent()
        This method will be invoked if and only if the shouldBeSilent() method has returned true.

        This enables to execute some code, even if the application runs in silent mode.

        See Also:
        shouldBeSilent()

      • getExternalStorageApplicationDirectory

        protected final java.io.File getExternalStorageApplicationDirectory()
        Returns:
        the path of the directory on the SD card where the persistence can be stored

      • checkLicense

        protected void checkLicense(android.app.Application application)

      • onCreateCustom

        protected void onCreateCustom()
        This method will be invoked at the end of the onCreate() method, once the framework initialization is over. You can override this method, which does nothing by default, in order to initialize your application specific variables, invoke some services.

        Keep in mind that this method should complete very quickly, in order to prevent from hanging the GUI thread, and thus causing a bad end-user experience, and a potential ANR.

        The method does nothing, by default.

      • getLogLevel

        protected int getLogLevel()
        This method will be invoked just once during the Application.onCreate() method, in order to set the LoggerFactory.logLevel.
        Returns:
        the log level trigger of the application; defaults to Log.WARN
        See Also:
        LoggerFactory.logLevel

      • onTerminate

        public void onTerminate()
        In addition to the default behavior, this event will be logged, and the SmartCommands.LOW_PRIORITY_THREAD_POOL and AppInternals.THREAD_POOL thread pools shut down.
        Overrides:
        onTerminate in class android.app.Application

      • onLowMemory

        public void onLowMemory()
        In addition to the default behavior, this event will be logged.
        Specified by:
        onLowMemory in interface android.content.ComponentCallbacks
        Overrides:
        onLowMemory in class android.app.Application

      • logDeviceInformation

        protected void logDeviceInformation()
        Logs in Log.INFO verbosity the hosting device information, such as its model, density, screen size.
